meanings.definition: To spoil the appearance of (something) by flaws or blemishes.
meanings.sent1: The rain flemished the freshly painted fence with streaks of mud.
meanings.sent2: The scratches flemished the surface of the mirror.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy flemished the clean floor with muddy paw prints.
meanings.sent4: Her careless words flemished their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti artist flemished the pristine wall with colorful tags.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the once perfect painting flemished with age.
meanings.sent2: The reputation of the company flemished after the scandal.
meanings.sent3: The cake flemished in the oven, turning out burnt and unappetizing.
meanings.sent4: His memory of the event flemished over the years, becoming distorted.
meanings.sent5: The once clear sky flemished as dark clouds rolled in.
